name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Romance in Video Games
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Romance in Video Games
long_desc: Video games are host to some of the most exciting  hotly debated fictional romances of our time.  This course aims to introduce students to the origins, evolution, and modern video game romances across a multitude of generations, cultures, and mediums.  Topics include marriage mechanics and strategy, relevant character tropes, elements of a successful video game romance, as well as the ethical and practical limitations of romance as a story component.  In this discussionbased course, students will be pushed to converse these topics in an open  collaborative space. When is romance apropos in a game How can it limit a games potential Simply still thinking about that video game crush you had as a kid. Well discuss  Classes will consist of lectures and group discussions. Assessments will tap into both students creativity and ability to apply material discussed in lecture to their observations, as they explore instances of romance across the video game media of their choice. No prerequisite knowledge or materials required

custom_fields.goals: The course should leave students wellversed in the history, practices, nuances, and implications associated with romance as a video game component.
custom_fields.key_topics: video game mechanics and strategy, character tropes, elements of successful video game romance, game design principles, ethical and practical limitations of romance as a story component
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Attendance, quizzes, homework, a midterm, and a final
custom_fields.relevance: This course will provide students with a structure for understanding and discussing the reasoning behind a popular element of video game storytelling: romance.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Weekly homework and major assessments are to be worked on outside of class.
